comments:
We have an application that may call IWorkbenchConfigurer.emergencyClose during our implementation of WorkbenchAdvisor.preStartup if anything is horribly wrong. However, the following exception is thrown because there are no windows.  Code in org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench should probably check that there are windows in the array.

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$13.run(Workbench.java:769)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)

	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.busyClose(Workbench.java:655)

	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$14.run(Workbench.java:839)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.close(Workbench.java:837)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchConfigurer.emergencyClose(WorkbenchConfigurer.java:165)
	at com.ineousa.ui.seDesktop.ApplicationWorkbenchAdvisor.preStartup(ApplicationWorkbenchAdvisor.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.init(Workbench.java:1083)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1847)

	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:92)
